section.title: Manual Backup Overview
section.para: This section covers manual backup and some restore processes. Full documentation for restore operations is in .To back up outside the cluster, refer to . Backups of the following types of resources are covered:

formalpara.title: &mariadb; database that is part of the Control Plane
formalpara.para: The &mariadb; database contains most of the data needed to restore services. &mariadb; supports full back up and recovery for all services. Logging data in &elasticsearch; is not backed up. &swift; objects are not backed up because of the redundant nature of &swift;.

formalpara.title: &swift; Rings used in the &swift; storage deployment
formalpara.para: &swift; rings are backed up so that you can recover more quickly than rebuilding with &swift;. &swift; can rebuild the rings without this backup data, but automatically rebuilding the rings is slower than restoring from a backup.

formalpara.title: Audit Logs
formalpara.para: Audit Logs are backed up to provide retrospective information and statistical data for performance and security purposes.

section.para: The following services will be backed up. Specifically, the data needed to restore the services is backed up. This includes databases and configuration-related files.

important.para: Data content for some services is not backed up, as indicated below.

listitem.para: &o_meter;. There is no backup of metrics data.
&o_blockstore;. There is no backup of the volumes.
&o_img;. There is no backup of the images.
&o_comp;. There is no backup of the images.
&o_monitor;. There is no backup of the metrics.
